meanings.definition: To travel beyond or farther than.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to outtravel her friends by visiting more countries.
meanings.sent2: The explorer managed to outtravel the previous record for distance traveled.
meanings.sent3: The snail challenged the cheetah to a race to see who could outtravel the other.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination could outtravel any physical journey she took.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship was designed to outtravel any other spacecraft in the galaxy.

meanings.sent1: The marathon runner aimed to outtravel his competitors by a significant margin.
meanings.sent2: The migratory birds always outtravel other species during their long journeys.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise decided to outtravel the hare in the race, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed allowed him to outtravel all obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The train was built to outtravel any other mode of transportation in speed and efficiency.
